p:
Lipids are mainly known for their role in energy storage
9, 10 , but they are also the main constituent of cellular membranes, and part of membrane rafts and anchors as well as signaling and transport molecules
11â€“ 15 . According to LIPID MAPS, lipids are classified into eight different classes, namely fatty acyls, glycerolipids, glycerophospholipids, sphingolipids, sterols, prenols, saccharolipids, and polyketides
16 . This classification of lipids is based on their chemical and biochemical properties. In light of the data availability, we focus in this study on the lipids belonging to the first five classes, of which the structural characteristics are shown in Supplementary Fig. 1.
